semantic_identifier: 93: feat: Onboarding: add Simple Mode with progressive disclosure for alerts/templates/models

sections.text:
## Description

Implements the new onboarding flow to support a “Simple Mode” experience backed by server-recommended defaults.

Key changes
- Adds a Simple Mode selection step in onboarding and persists the chosen mode in the onboarding state.
- On selecting Simple Mode, fetches backend default recommendations (alerts/templates/models) and applies them as the initial configuration used by the rest of onboarding.
- Updates onboarding screens to show only core workflows in Simple Mode (forecasting, next-best-action, risk alerts) with concise, explainable summaries of what will be enabled/configured.
- Moves advanced alert/template/model controls behind an “Advanced settings” accordion in Simple Mode; advanced controls remain fully available in Advanced Mode.
- Adds the ability to switch from Simple → Advanced later while keeping the previously applied defaults (no config reset; only additional controls become visible).

Implementation notes
- Introduces a mode-aware UI layer (Simple vs Advanced) that gates sections/controls via feature flags/conditional rendering, while sharing the same underlying configuration model.
- Adds a small config-application layer to map backend defaults into the existing client configuration shape (idempotent apply; no destructive overwrites when toggling modes).
- Ensures state persistence across navigation/back/refresh during onboarding (mode + applied defaults).

User impact
- New users can complete onboarding faster using Simple Mode with safe defaults and can expand to Advanced Mode at any time without losing their initial setup.

## How Has This Been Tested?
